intro: Cyrtandra × kamooaliiensis, commonly known as the Kona cyrtandra, is a hybrid plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along stream banks and in forest understories. It has elliptical to ovate leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
